page.title: 15INTERVIEW AT LANGDON BARTON
page.content: {Mr Andrews}the present owner of Langd- on Barton Farm can remember his mother talking about{life at Langdon since {1903}when the farm was part of the Cory Family Estate.{She saw the change {from horse-power to tractors.}The hor- ses were last worked in 1950. Then there were 20 - 12 shires and 8 colts. {The first tractor was American, called {an "Overtime",bought during WW1.}In 1927 the Cory Estates were sold, and John Andrews bought the buildings and 200 acres for Â£5650.{In 1935 7 local {men were employed here. A cow then {cost Â£20.}Cattle and sheep were kept, and swedes and potatoes grown.{In 1936 {electricity came, mains water not unt- {il 1948.}Before this the pump in the yard was used.{This often ran dry,and {the well at Raneleigh Farm was borrow- {ed.}Before WW1{poverty}was great, and the Andrews took local{apprentices.
